title: As Texas Deals with Recent Violence, Looser Gun Laws in State Take Effect
summary: Gun-control advocates say laws put more people in danger; Supporters say they make it easier to self-defend. A series of laws easing gun regulation in Texas that were passed earlier this year took effect on Sunday as the second-largest state in the U.S. was responding to a second shooting rampage in a month.

title: Argentine Government Imposes Capital Controls
summary: Measures aim to restrict dollar sales, contain foreign-exchange depletion ahead of presidential election in October. BUENOS AIRES-Argentina's government imposed capital controls in its latest bid to prevent a depletion of foreign-currency reserves amid a crisis of confidence that has fueled dollar outflows and financial-market turbulence.

title: Pope Francis to Appoint 13 New Cardinals
summary: Pontiff's choices are consistent with his interest in the developing world and relations with Muslims. ROME-Pope Francis named 13 men whom he would appoint as cardinals next month, with the choices highlighting some of his signature concerns: the developing world, relations with Islam and advocacy for migrants.

title: Death Toll Rises to Seven in Texas Rampage
summary: The gunman may have been heading into a crowded movie theater when he was killed. The death toll from a shooting rampage in West Texas rose to seven on Sunday as officials identified the gunman, but remained unsure about his motive.

title: Pence Asserts U.S. Support for Poland
summary: Vice president, speaking at event in Warsaw, emphasizes nation's role as an American security ally while also reiterating backing for Ukraine. WARSAW-Poland commemorated the 80th anniversary of the outbreak of World War II in a solemn ceremony in which Vice President Mike Pence asserted continued U.S. support for what the Trump administration has come to view as a reliable security ally.

title: Israel Fires Shells Into Lebanon After Hezbollah Missile Strike
summary: No one is injured in incident, which stokes fears of broader regional conflict between Israelis and Iran. Israel fired scores of artillery shells into southern Lebanon in response to a missile attack by Hezbollah, raising fears of a broader conflict amid growing regional tensions between Israel and Iran.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Manufacturing, Trade and August Jobs Report
summary: Economists will closely eye Labor Department data for any signs the global slowdown is spreading to the U.S..

title: In Zimbabwe, Promise of Mobile Money Fades When the Power Goes Out
summary: Ecocash, the cellphone platform used for eight out of 10 financial transactions, regularly breaks down. DOMBOSHAVA, Zimbabwe-With the crowd behind him getting restless, Silas Hwamiridza frantically punched his cellphone's keys, trying to make a payment for gas at his local station.

title: U.S. Says It Is 'at the Threshold' of an Afghan Withdrawal Agreement
summary: Chief American negotiator visits Kabul to brief government on the deal. KABUL-With a landmark deal with the Taliban nearly completed, the U.S. diplomat overseeing peace talks with the insurgents arrived in Kabul on Sunday to brief top Afghan officials on the accord and to discuss next steps on a comprehensive settlement of the nearly 18-year Afghan war.

title: Saudi Coalition Strikes Prison in Yemen, Killing About 100
summary: Airstrike hits center holding detainees captured by Houthis. The Saudi-led coalition fighting a rebel group in Yemen launched airstrikes that killed an estimated 100 people at a prison holding detainees captured by the Iran-aligned Houthi movement, the International Committee of the Red Cross said Sunday.

title: Venture-Capital Stalwart Fights Crypto Crackdown
summary: Andreessen Horowitz, known for Facebook investment, says digital currencies can cure what ails web. Venture-capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, known for early investments in innovative companies such as Facebook Inc., is putting up a fight against Washington's cryptocurrency crackdown.

title: China's Red-Hot Tobacco Stock Is Cooling
summary: China Tobacco International is a very poor proxy for the country's lucrative cigarette industry.

title: Urban Zen for a Woman Walking on Air
summary: A New Yorker helps maintain her balance with a rigorous year-round practice on a piece of webbing just 1 inch wide. Dustin Lindblad regularly causes rushed New Yorkers to stop in their tracks and watch as she balances in tree pose on a slackline strung near the George Washington Bridge.

title: Hong Kong Protests Disrupt Airport Access, Snarling Trains and Roads
summary: City's subway operator suspends rail link as protesters mass near aviation hub. HONG KONG-Antigovernment protests disrupted the city's airport Sunday, with authorities canceling trains, which led to hourslong traffic jams on partially blocked roads that forced some travelers to walk miles with their luggage.

title: At Least Five Killed, Multiple Hurt in Texas Shooting
summary: Shooter killed by police after opening fire in West Texas cities of Midland and Odessa; Three of the 21 shot were law-enforcement officers. At least five people died and more than a dozen were injured in the West Texas cities of Midland and Odessa after a shooter began randomly firing at people Saturday afternoon, Odessa Police Chief Michael Gerke said. The suspect was killed by police.

title: Coco Gauff's U.S. Open Run Is Over. Here's What to Expect for the Future.
summary: Now that the 15-year-old's tennis season is done, she will try to improve pretty much everything. And she has a lot of time.. Fifteen-year-old Cori "Coco" Gauff's exciting runs at the U.S. Open and Wimbledon has glossed over an important truth about her future. To navigate the uncertain road from teen phenom to major-title holder, the ambitious teen now has to improve just about every part of her game.

title: Germany's Small Steps Into Stimulus Are Unlikely to Meet Economists' Hopes
summary: International organizations and others have urged Berlin for months to spend more to fight a looming recession. BERLIN-As Germany's economy shrinks, the government is about to loosen the purse strings-a little bit, and very discreetly.

title: Fierce Hurricane Dorian Threatens Coastal Southeast
summary: Storm path could veer closer to Georgia, South Carolina. MIAMI-Hurricane Dorian slogged toward the Bahamas and Florida as a fierce Category 4 storm and threatened a widening stretch of the southeastern U.S.

title: Truck Makers Apply the Brakes
summary: Trade tensions, slower global growth are depressing freight volumes after banner year for industry. Truck makers are logging sharply lower orders, adding another stress point for a decelerating U.S. manufacturing sector.

title: For Those Who Don't See Themselves as Male or Female, Growing Acceptance-and Accommodation
summary: More states, firms join shift toward recognizing gender-nonconforming Americans. A growing number of states and companies are allowing people to designate their gender as "X" instead of male or female on driver's licenses and other forms of identification.

title: Violence Erupts in Hong Kong as Protesters Defy Ban
summary: Police fire water cannons and tear gas to disperse protesters besieging city's government headquarters. HONG KONG-Police fired blue dye from water cannons and volleys of tear gas to disperse protesters besieging Hong Kong's government headquarters, as tens of thousands took to the streets in defiance of a ban on antigovernment demonstrations.

title: Taliban Fighters Attack Afghan City of Kunduz Amid Talks to Finalize U.S. Withdrawal
summary: Taliban suicide bombing in Kunduz town square kills 10, leaves police chief wounded. KABUL-Taliban fighters stormed the northern Afghan city of Kunduz on Saturday, U.S. and Afghan military officials said, even as negotiators for the hard-line Islamist militia seek to finalize a U.S. troop withdrawal deal with American negotiators in Qatar.

title: U.S. Goes Ahead With New Tariffs on Chinese Products
summary: U.S. duties of 15% on tools, apparel items, some footwear and many electronics are expected to hit consumers. Tariffs on clothing and other imports from China went into effect on Sunday, escalating the trade war in a move expected to squarely hit consumers.

title: Why Hurricane Dorian Is So Hard to Track
summary: Many factors-from high-pressure systems to wind currents-can mean big changes in the projected path. The constant shifting of Hurricane Dorian's likely track prompted an official from the Federal Emergency Management Agency on Saturday to deem the Category 4 storm a "long-duration nail-biter."

title: Naomi Osaka Overwhelms Coco Gauff at the U.S. Open
summary: The world's No. 1 player ends the 15-year-old's run in the third round. NEW YORK-Cori "Coco" Gauff has already proven the Grand Slam spotlight isn't too bright for a 15-year-old. After two thrilling wins here at the U.S. Open, she has quickly become a crowd favorite with her powerful groundstrokes and an energetic game.
